author: binh
title: An asset token platform on Cardano
description: Неликвидные активы (запасы, недвижимость, другие) были лишены ликвидности. Токенизация таких активов создает для них ликвидность.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal directly addresses the spirit and intent of the Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the author is impressively educated, the how is missing. How will this project after the creation of its utility token and its asset token convince users to relinquish their ownership of real-world assets to this project?  While the technical seems largely covered, the business plan is missing in its entirety--> these are very very different customers to serve: "Three main components of the asset token platform on Cardano:

• Asset tokenizsation service

• Barter exchange

• P2P decentralized lending

- The Vietnam asset markets:

• Commodity inventories (of SMEs)

• Real Estate

• Corporate bond and equity."

There does not appear to be a plan to add business skill to this project team, therefore, the likelihood of this project's successful implementation is less than highly likely.
f6_assessments.q2:
My earlier comment about the dearth of business plans underlies the general insufficiency of auditable plans for progress and success.

The roadmap is broad, containing actions that are actually quite large unauditable collections of actions, for instance: "- July– December 2023: increasing member number of barter exchange up to 1000; connecting the platform with the global crypto exchanges."
f6_assessments.reply:

In the whitepaper, we are going to make a business plan in detail.
We are also verifying the types of risk this Project is going to face with.

Briefly, the main types of risk include techical risk, economic and market risks, legal and regulatory risks.

Economic and Market risks: This business model relates to:
Tokenizing assets
Custody and Asset evaluation/auditing;
Trading and lending based on asset tokens;

Legal and regulatory risks:
There is still lacking of legal framework to run Defi lending and crypto exchange in Vietnam. This model should get sandbox’s permission of the local government;
Tokenizing real estate assets also encountering with legal and regulatory risks; the legal framework for this is not clear yet;
Regarding to tokenizing financial assets (equity and bonds), it is also lacking legal framework.

f6_assessments.q0: This is definitely a good idea to address a problem that the Cardano chain currently suffers from, which is the lack of a market for trading traditional/real assets in its Defi space.  However the explanation for how it can bring value to Cardano is vague at best.  What about the idea will onboard those who are outside of the crypto environment, as well as those already using the linked platforms on Ethereum?  This proposal idea definitely falls within the specifications of the challenge, but again the KPI's and goals are vague and do not provide much of a "how?"  It also mentions goals of scaling up to more exchange members as time goes on but there is no explanation provided for how the project plans to do that either.  I would suggest for future proposals to go into more detail on how each goal will be accomplished.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provides great references to how this idea has succeeded on Ethereum.  However it has not provided much information on the team's experience in this area.  Based on the roadmap it is unclear whether a team has even been established yet.  The requested budget seems to only be enough to propel the proposal through step 1 of the road map (paying the team through March to write the technical document.)  What is your plan for additional funding past that point?  How much additional funding will the project require?  Will the project use social media, a token sale, VC funding, etc?  As stated above, there is very little clarification on "how" any of the roadmap milestones are to be accomplished.  I am also curious what type of obstacles the project has ahead of it in order to successfully penetrate such markets as the Vietnam real estate market and others, both legally and politically.  I really am intrigued by this proposal, but in the future I would recommend being more thorough in order to justify the use of the Catalyst Fund.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap for the project is not too ambitious for such a large proposed undertaking.  Each goal provides flexibility on when it is to be completed with a wide range of completion dates.  However that can also be viewed as a lack of knowledge on how long each goal will/should take.  The main goal for success of this challenge is to have four Defi dapps launched on Cardano in 2022.  Based on the roadmap this proposal will not be set to launch until early to mid 2023.  The roadmap also states that membership is to be grown leading up to test-net and into main-net but does not provide details on how the community will be grown.  For future proposals I suggest a heavier focus on clarity and process details.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal addresses the future where everything will be tokenized as mentioned by Charles Hoskinson by proposing a asset token platform. The proposal aligns with the challenge and tackles real world opportunities in the near future. The proposer also provide examples of reaseach in the space as we as similar projects on Ethereum.
Metrics are presented in a way of a number of SME onboarded.
Having such an exchange would clearly benefit the wider DeFi (asset) growth on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is an experienced Ph.D with background in finance, but would need to build the team to deliver. The background info on similar projects is extensive, but the actual implementation on Cardano is a bit lacking due to the lack of IT background. With that in mind, time estimates might be arbitrary and are not adressed as risk. It would be beneficial to see some risk mitigation or possible challenges and is the reason for point deduction.
The budget is clear, for required personnel costs only.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap and milestones are defined, as well as measurable KPIs. It would be easy to monitor if the expected values have been reached to measure the success of the platform.
The problem (lack of real world asset tokens - inventories, real estates, others) that is addressed is clear and the solution (asset platform) is sound. The platform would provide liquidity for these assets by turning them into smaller parts which are more easily tradeable.

solution: Построение платформы токенов активов на Cardano, в сочетании с бартерной биржей, дает хорошее решение проблемы неликвидности реальных активов.
